info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 13 at 6:06PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CARSON...HUTCHINSON...SOUTHEASTERN HANSFORD... NORTHWESTERN ROBERTS AND SOUTHWESTERN OCHILTREE COUNTIES... At 606 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 20 miles northeast of Skellytown to 4 miles east of Morse, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Borger, Spearman, Fritch, Stinnett, Sanford, and Pringle. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
